clues: A gentle giant whose memory is the stuff of legend
This grey creature has a long trunk and enormous fan-like ears
The largest land animal on Earth, native to Africa and Asia
A stronghold where power once sat behind thick walls
This fortified structure features towers, battlements, and a moat
A medieval fortress where kings and queens held court
Six voices sing when fingers dance across its neck
A stringed instrument with a hollow body and a long fretted neck
The most popular instrument in rock and folk music, strummed or picked
A vast expanse that covers most of our world in blue
This enormous body of salt water is home to whales and coral reefs
The Atlantic, Pacific, Indian, and Arctic are all examples of this
A quiet sentinel that sacrifices itself to banish darkness
Made of wax with a central wick, it provides a flickering flame
You light it for ambiance, blow it out on birthday cakes
Eighty-eight teeth that sing when struck in the right order
A large keyboard instrument with black and white keys
A musical instrument with hammers that strike strings inside a wooden case
A promise made between two shores that the gap shall not divide them
A structure built to span a river, valley, or road
You drive or walk across this to get over water or a chasm
An eight-legged architect that weaves its home from silk
This arachnid spins webs to catch flies and other insects
A small creature with eight legs that makes webs, not an insect
It pierces the sky and challenges those who would stand at its peak
A massive landform rising high above the surrounding terrain
Everest, Kilimanjaro, and Denali are famous examples of this
A portable shield against the sky's tears
This collapsible device opens into a canopy to keep you dry
You carry it on rainy days — it has a handle and a fabric dome
Born under tremendous pressure, it emerges as the hardest beauty
This precious gemstone is made of pure carbon and sparkles brilliantly
The hardest natural substance, often set in engagement rings
A sleeping giant whose anger reshapes the land in fire
This geological formation erupts with lava, ash, and gases
A mountain with an opening that spews molten rock when it erupts
A faithful needle that always knows where home lies
This navigational instrument uses magnetism to point toward a pole
A device with a magnetic needle that always points north
A cathedral of silence where knowledge lives on shelves
This public building houses thousands of books for borrowing
A place filled with books where you can read or study quietly
It begins as a crawler and ends as a painter of the air
This insect undergoes metamorphosis from caterpillar to winged beauty
A colorful flying insect with large patterned wings, once a caterpillar
The sky's voice, arriving after its bright companion has already spoken
This loud rumbling sound follows a flash during a storm
The booming noise caused by lightning heating the air rapidly
It shows you a world that exists only when you stand before it
A flat reflective surface made of glass coated with metal
You look into this every morning to see your own reflection
A green kingdom where the canopy hides the sky from the earth
A large area densely covered with trees and undergrowth
The Amazon and Black are famous examples of this tree-filled biome
It finds peace at the bottom so that others may rest above
This heavy metal device is lowered to the seabed to hold a vessel steady
A ship drops this heavy hooked object to stop drifting
A caged star you can carry through the darkest night
This portable light source encloses a flame behind glass panels
A lamp with a protective case, often carried by a handle
A formal dresser who traded flight for the art of swimming
This black-and-white bird waddles on ice and swims expertly
A flightless bird that lives in Antarctica and looks like it wears a tuxedo
It brings the unreachable close enough to study in silence
This optical instrument uses lenses or mirrors to magnify distant objects
Galileo used one to observe the moons of Jupiter
A tamed patch of earth where patience blooms into color
An enclosed area of land used for growing flowers, vegetables, or herbs
A plot of cultivated ground where you plant seeds and pull weeds
An inseparable companion that vanishes when the light does
This dark silhouette appears when an object blocks a light source
The dark shape cast on the ground when you stand in sunlight
A guardian that sits atop the most vital tower of the body
This protective headgear absorbs impact to shield the skull
Worn on the head for safety when biking, building, or fighting
A restless traveler that carves its own path to the sea
A natural flowing watercourse that moves toward a lake or ocean
The Nile, Amazon, and Mississippi are famous examples of this
A patient counter that never stops measuring what cannot be saved
This device displays hours and minutes using hands or digits
It hangs on a wall or sits on a desk and tells you the time
A winged terror of legend whose breath is destruction itself
This mythical reptilian creature flies and breathes fire
A legendary fire-breathing beast with wings, scales, and a tail
A piece of the world that chose solitude, surrounded on all sides
A body of land entirely surrounded by water, smaller than a continent
Hawaii, Madagascar, and Iceland are all examples of this landform
A spine of rungs that offers ascent where stairs dare not go
This portable climbing device has two vertical rails connected by horizontal steps
You lean it against a wall and climb it rung by rung
A tiny instrument powered by breath that commands attention
This small device produces a high-pitched sound when air passes through it
Referees blow this to stop play, and you can do it with your lips
That which is sought by those who follow old maps and older dreams
A collection of valuable items — gold, jewels, coins — often hidden away
Pirates buried this, and X marks the spot on the map
Lighter than thought, yet it once carried its owner through the sky
This lightweight structure grows from a bird's skin and enables flight
A soft, flat growth from a bird, once used as a quill pen
A challenge that exists in pieces, demanding patience to become whole
A game or problem designed to test ingenuity and knowledge
A jigsaw type has interlocking pieces that form a picture
Born from patience and pressure, its geometry is perfection itself
A solid material whose atoms are arranged in a highly ordered structure
Quartz, amethyst, and salt are common examples of this mineral form
The day's final masterpiece, painted in fire across the horizon
This daily event colors the sky orange and red as the sun descends
The moment each evening when the sun disappears below the horizon
A wall you can carry, standing between danger and the one who holds it
This defensive equipment is held on the arm to block attacks
A broad piece of armor carried by warriors like knights and Vikings
A furious column that connects wrath above to destruction below
This violent rotating column of air extends from a thunderstorm to the ground
A twisting funnel of wind that destroys buildings, common in the American Midwest
Neither plant nor animal, it thrives where others have fallen
This fleshy organism grows from soil or decaying matter and has a cap and stem
A fungus with a stem and umbrella-shaped cap, found in forests and on pizza
A frozen moment of triumph, displayed so victory is never forgotten
This decorative item is awarded as a prize for winning a competition
A cup or figurine on a pedestal given to the winner of a contest
An open embrace for the foot, favored when warmth invites freedom
This light shoe has straps that expose most of the foot
An open-toed summer shoe held on by straps, like flip-flops
A bridge of color that appears when tears and light make peace
This arc of spectral colors appears when sunlight refracts through rain
A multicolored arc in the sky after rain — red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, violet
A wall's eye, letting light enter without letting the world in
This opening in a building is filled with glass to admit light and air
A glass-paned opening in a wall that you look through or open for fresh air
A box that steals moments and keeps them perfectly still forever
This device uses a lens to capture light and record images
You point it at something and press a button to take a photograph
A patient survivor that wears a coat of needles in the driest lands
This desert plant stores water in its thick stem and is covered in spines
A spiny green plant that grows in deserts and needs very little water
A line of steel drawn between one fate and another
This bladed weapon has a long metal edge, a hilt, and a crossguard
A sharp metal weapon swung by knights, samurai, and fantasy heroes
A guardian that sits atop the most vital tower of the body
This protective headgear absorbs impact to shield the skull
Worn on the head for safety when biking, building, or fighting
A tall sentinel on the shore whose eye warns travelers of danger
This tower emits a powerful beam of light to guide ships at night
A tall coastal tower with a bright rotating light that warns ships of rocks
A small keeper of value that rides in your pocket through every journey
This folding case holds cash, cards, and identification documents
A small flat case you carry in your pocket for money and credit cards
The whole world made small enough to spin beneath your fingertips
This spherical model represents the Earth's surface with continents and oceans
A round map of the world that sits on a stand and can be rotated
Not knowledge itself, but the quiet art of knowing when to use it
This quality combines experience, knowledge, and good judgment
The ability to make sound decisions — what comes with age and experience
